author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: KernelAbstractions, Oceananigans, julia

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

@tomchor thanks for your contribution!  Besides the issues mentioned above, that must be addressed, the package must have an OSI-approved license.  Also, it'd be good to have tests, the package doesn't seem to have any at the moment.

@giordano Thanks for the feedback! One of the packages it depends on (Oceananigans.jl) actually gets a new release very often. So having an upper bound to it may actually make it a big burden for me to maintain this package. I might just keep it as a github repo for until Oceananigans.jl gets a little more stable maybe.

I'll definitely add the license though!
Just trigger registration again, like what you did before, without changing the version number: this will simply update this pull request
Thanks. I did it again but I had since bumped the version so it opened a new PR [here](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/31318).
That's exactly why I told you to not change the version number :slightly_smiling_face:

Yeah, sorry! 

I had already changed it over the past week! Since another package was using a specific version as a dependency I couldn't change back to the original version...

body:

title: New package: Oceanostics v0.1.0
